subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Hi, folks
msgSnippet: Andy: I remember your name from the past.  I started the Read_Alphabet group after having used QS for 25+ years because I felt those of us who favor QS over
messageBody:
Andy:

I remember your name from the past.  I started the Read_Alphabet group after having used QS for 25+ years because I felt those of us who favor QS over Shavian needed a forum to develop the QS resources available on the net.  Unfortnately, I have so many demands on my time, that I have not been able to devote the time to the group that I would like to.

We still need an improved version of Jerome (font) to communicate in.  Jon Zuck did a great job getting us started, but Jerome still has some problems that need to be addressed

I am using a hybrid Linux/Windows OS, and have not worked out how to use Jerome or a version thereof on my Linux box yet, which in the past few months has kept me from sending messages on the site using QS.

Ewout introduced us to the use of a program called Keyman to let us remap our keyboards to type QS, including its half-letters.  I prepared a key mapping, based upon Jon Zuck's and my own ideas, which is predicated upon some of the traditional roman alphabet orthography.  This  makes typing in QS much easier than the desparately unintuitive mapping the Shavian group uses.   I sent a couple of e-mails about this back in late winter or early spring but received no feedback so I have no idea if anyone in the group besides myself is using this presently.

Good to hear from you again.

Paige Gabhart

andy_callaway wrote:

 I've just joined this group. I've been interested in spelling reform
for a number of years now, and have been looking around at the
different alternatives. A couple of years ago, I got interested in
Shavian, and some time after that Quikscript.

Some of you may know my name. I see a couple of familiar names in
here, possible from alt.language.english.spelling.reform. I was the
one who created the Shaw Script font, and the Rosetta phonetic
translator.

I look forward to Reading (pun) with you!

Andy Callaway
